org.spongepowered.api.world

Interface PortalAgent


  • public interface PortalAgent
    An agent that handles teleportation between Location's. This can be understood as an agent that handles the creation of "portals" between World's.

    An example is the agent handling nether portals.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Optional<Location<World>> createPortal(Location<World> targetLocation)
      Tells this agent to create a new "portal" location at the suggested Location.
      Optional<Location<World>> findOrCreatePortal(Location<World> targetLocation)
      Attempts to find a "portal" location, or if none are available, creates one.
      Optional<Location<World>> findPortal(Location<World> targetLocation)
      Attempts to find a "portal" location.
      int getCreationRadius()
      Gets the radius of where a "portal" can be created.
      int getSearchRadius()
      Gets the search radius before a new acceptable "portal" location is created.
      PortalAgentType getType()
      Gets the type of PortalAgent.
      PortalAgent setCreationRadius(int radius)
      Sets the creation radius of where a portal may be created.
      PortalAgent setSearchRadius(int radius)
      Sets the search radius before a new acceptable "portal" location is created.

      • findOrCreatePortal

        Optional<Location<World>> findOrCreatePortal(Location<World> targetLocation)
        Attempts to find a "portal" location, or if none are available, creates one. Returns Optional.empty() if none are found.
        Parameters:
        targetLocation - The suggested location
        Returns:
        The found location of the "portal", if available

      • findPortal

        Optional<Location<World>> findPortal(Location<World> targetLocation)
        Attempts to find a "portal" location. Returns Optional.empty() if none are found.
        Parameters:
        targetLocation - The suggested location
        Returns:
        The found location of the "portal", if available

      • createPortal

        Optional<Location<World>> createPortal(Location<World> targetLocation)
        Tells this agent to create a new "portal" location at the suggested Location. If ChangeBlockEvent.Place is cancelled, Optional.empty() is returned.

        Note: In order to adjust or prevent the Location's of each BlockState set, listen to ChangeBlockEvent.Place and check for the root cause of this portal agent.
        Parameters:
        targetLocation - The targeted location
        Returns:
        The newly created "portal" location, if available

      • getType

        PortalAgentType getType()
        Gets the type of PortalAgent.
        Returns:
        The type
